body.p:
To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky
Sir,

L Tobin, a citizen of Frankfort, was charged, in the police court of said city, with selling liquors to W. W. Estill. Richard Powell, C F Rogers, C. F. Rogers, Brutus J Clay. Lewis Jones, and Charles Miller on the 13th day of February 1864:

To Richard Buckner, Ed Grun, Luther Wright. on the 11th day of February 1864. and to Charles Rogers, Jas Powell Richard Buckner on the 15th day of January 1864., all of whom are minors. in which cases the said Tobin, confessed judgement, relying on that mercy, which the law empowers, your honour to exercise for the releif of persons deserving.

Therefore we the undersigned believing that the said Tobin was more unfortunate than guilty, that his violation of the law was, totally through ignorance of any prohibition, to a selling to the aforesaid class of persons, and further believing. That the costs & c in the thirteen cases, would be an adequate punishment for the offences committed and that the object of the law would be fully
sustained by the exercise of your clemency in his behalf do hereby petition the remission of the fines, fees, and costs excepted in said cases.

H I Todd
A. C. Fleming
Nelson Alley
Saml Steche
Geo A Robertson
Jno. M. Hewitt Jr.
J. M. Helms
Thos. J. Frazier
Jas S Sneed
J. W. Pruett
Robert A Taylor
J. W. Markham
D Merewether

Frankfort Police Ct
vs
L Tobin

Remit the fine in all the 13 cases except fees & costs
Apl 19th 1864
Thos E Bramlette
Govr
Selling liquor to minors
fine of $50 in each case
